intro: Liebigia tobaensis, commonly known as the Tobaensis liebigia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or riverine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
